delete.summary:
tapcli: `universe delete`
DeleteAssetRoot deletes the Universe root for a specific asset, including
all asoociated universe keys, leaves, and events.

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation list`
ListFederationServers lists the set of servers that make up the federation
of the local Universe server. This servers are used to push out new proofs,
and also periodically call sync new proofs from the remote server.

delete.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation del`
DeleteFederationServer removes a server from the federation of the local
Universe server.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation add`
AddFederationServer adds a new server to the federation of the local
Universe server. Once a server is added, this call can also optionally be
used to trigger a sync of the remote server.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe info`
Info returns a set of information about the current state of the Universe
and allows a caller to check that a universe server is reachable and
configured correctly to allow proof courier access without macaroons.

tapcli: `universe keys`
AssetLeafKeys queries for the set of Universe keys associated with a given
asset_id or group_key. Each key takes the form: (outpoint, script_key),
where outpoint is an outpoint in the Bitcoin blockchain that anchors a
valid Taproot Asset commitment, and script_key is the script_key of
the asset within the Taproot Asset commitment for the given asset_id or
group_key.

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for the page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The length limit for the page.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction of the page.

 - SORT_DIRECTION_DESC: Sort results in descending order.
 - SORT_DIRECTION_ASC: Sort results in ascending order.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe keys`
AssetLeafKeys queries for the set of Universe keys associated with a given
asset_id or group_key. Each key takes the form: (outpoint, script_key),
where outpoint is an outpoint in the Bitcoin blockchain that anchors a
valid Taproot Asset commitment, and script_key is the script_key of
the asset within the Taproot Asset commitment for the given asset_id or
group_key.

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for the page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The length limit for the page.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction of the page.

 - SORT_DIRECTION_DESC: Sort results in descending order.
 - SORT_DIRECTION_ASC: Sort results in ascending order.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe leaves`
AssetLeaves queries for the set of asset leaves (the values in the Universe
MS-SMT tree) for a given asset_id or group_key. These represents either
asset issuance events (they have a genesis witness) or asset transfers that
took place on chain. The leaves contain a normal Taproot Asset proof, as
well as details for the asset.

parameters.name: asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe leaves`
AssetLeaves queries for the set of asset leaves (the values in the Universe
MS-SMT tree) for a given asset_id or group_key. These represents either
asset issuance events (they have a genesis witness) or asset transfers that
took place on chain. The leaves contain a normal Taproot Asset proof, as
well as details for the asset.

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe multiverse`
MultiverseRoot returns the root of the multiverse tree. This is useful to
determine the equality of two multiverse trees, since the root can directly
be compared to another multiverse root to find out if a sync is required.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs query`
QueryProof attempts to query for an issuance or transfer proof for a given
asset based on its UniverseKey. A UniverseKey is composed of the Universe
ID (asset_id/group_key) and also a leaf key (outpoint || script_key). If
found, then the issuance proof is returned that includes an inclusion proof
to the known Universe root, as well as a Taproot Asset state transition or
issuance proof for the said asset.

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs insert`
InsertProof attempts to insert a new issuance or transfer proof into the
Universe tree specified by the UniverseKey. If valid, then the proof is
inserted into the database, with a new Universe root returned for the
updated asset_id/group_key.

parameters.name: key.id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs query`
QueryProof attempts to query for an issuance or transfer proof for a given
asset based on its UniverseKey. A UniverseKey is composed of the Universe
ID (asset_id/group_key) and also a leaf key (outpoint || script_key). If
found, then the issuance proof is returned that includes an inclusion proof
to the known Universe root, as well as a Taproot Asset state transition or
issuance proof for the said asset.

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs insert`
InsertProof attempts to insert a new issuance or transfer proof into the
Universe tree specified by the UniverseKey. If valid, then the proof is
inserted into the database, with a new Universe root returned for the
updated asset_id/group_key.

parameters.name: key.id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs push`
PushProof attempts to query the local universe for a proof specified by a
UniverseKey. If found, a connection is made to a remote Universe server to
attempt to upload the asset leaf.

parameters.name: key.id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe proofs push`
PushProof attempts to query the local universe for a proof specified by a
UniverseKey. If found, a connection is made to a remote Universe server to
attempt to upload the asset leaf.

parameters.name: key.id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.hash_str
parameters.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

parameters.name: key.leaf_key.op.index
parameters.description: The index of the output.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe roots`
AssetRoots queries for the known Universe roots associated with each known
asset. These roots represent the supply/audit state for each known asset.

parameters.name: with_amounts_by_id
parameters.description:
If true, then the response will include the amounts for each asset ID
of grouped assets.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for the page.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The length limit for the page.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction of the page.

 - SORT_DIRECTION_DESC: Sort results in descending order.
 - SORT_DIRECTION_ASC: Sort results in ascending order.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe roots`
QueryAssetRoots attempts to locate the current Universe root for a specific
asset. This asset can be identified by its asset ID or group key.

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe roots`
QueryAssetRoots attempts to locate the current Universe root for a specific
asset. This asset can be identified by its asset ID or group key.

parameters.name: id.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: id.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: id.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: id.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe stats`
UniverseStats returns a set of aggregate statistics for the current state
of the Universe. Stats returned include: total number of syncs, total
number of proofs, and total number of known assets.

tapcli `universe stats assets`
QueryAssetStats returns a set of statistics for a given set of assets.
Stats can be queried for all assets, or based on the: asset ID, name, or
asset type. Pagination is supported via the offset and limit params.
Results can also be sorted based on any of the main query params.

parameters.name: asset_name_filter
parameters.description: The asset name filter. If this is empty, then all assets are returned.

parameters.name: asset_id_filter
parameters.description: The asset ID filter. If this is empty, then all assets are returned.

parameters.name: asset_type_filter
parameters.description:
The asset type filter. If this is set to FILTER_ASSET_NONE, then all
assets are returned. If set to FILTER_ASSET_NORMAL, then only normal
assets are returned. If set to FILTER_ASSET_COLLECTIBLE, then only
collectible assets are returned.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description:
The sort order for the query. If this is set to SORT_BY_NONE, then the
results are not sorted.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset for the page. This is used for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The length limit for the page. This is used for pagination.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description:
The direction of the sort. If this is set to SORT_DIRECTION_ASC, then
the results are sorted in ascending order. If set to
SORT_DIRECTION_DESC, then the results are sorted in descending order.

 - SORT_DIRECTION_DESC: Sort results in descending order.
 - SORT_DIRECTION_ASC: Sort results in ascending order.

get.summary:
tapcli `universe stats events`
QueryEvents returns the number of sync and proof events for a given time
period, grouped by day.

parameters.name: start_timestamp
parameters.description: The start timestamp for the query, in Unix epoch time (seconds).

parameters.name: end_timestamp
parameters.description: The end timestamp for the query, in Unix epoch time (seconds).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe ignoreoutpoint`
IgnoreAssetOutPoint allows an asset issuer to mark a specific asset outpoint
as ignored. An ignored outpoint will be included in the next universe supply
commitment transaction that is published.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe supplyleaves`
FetchSupplyLeaves fetches the supply leaves for a specific asset group
within a specified block height range. The leaves include issuance, burn,
and ignore leaves, which represent the supply changes for the asset group.

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: group_key_bytes
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: block_height_start
parameters.description: The start block height for the range of supply leaves to fetch.

parameters.name: block_height_end
parameters.description: The end block height for the range of supply leaves to fetch.

parameters.name: issuance_leaf_keys
parameters.description:
Optional: A list of issuance leaf keys. For each key in this list,
the endpoint will generate and return an inclusion proof.

parameters.name: burn_leaf_keys
parameters.description:
Optional: A list of burn leaf keys. For each key in this list,
the endpoint will generate and return an inclusion proof.

parameters.name: ignore_leaf_keys
parameters.description:
Optional: A list of ignore leaf keys. For each key in this list, the
endpoint will generate and return an inclusion proof.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe updatesupplycommit`
UpdateSupplyCommit updates the on-chain supply commitment for a specific
asset group.

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe fetchsupplycommit`
FetchSupplyCommit fetches the on-chain supply commitment for a specific
asset group.

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: group_key_bytes
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: commit_outpoint.txid
parameters.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

parameters.name: commit_outpoint.output_index
parameters.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

parameters.name: spent_commit_outpoint.txid
parameters.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

parameters.name: spent_commit_outpoint.output_index
parameters.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

parameters.name: very_first
parameters.description:
Fetch the very first supply commitment for the asset group. This
returns the initial supply commitment that spent the pre-commitment
output of the very first asset mint of a grouped asset (also known
as the group anchor). This is useful as the starting point to fetch
all supply commitments for a grouped asset one by one.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description:
Fetch the latest supply commitment for the asset group. This returns
the most recent supply commitment that is anchored on chain for the
asset group. This is useful to always get the current supply state
of the asset group.

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe supplycommit insert`
InsertSupplyCommit inserts a supply commitment for a specific asset
group. This includes the commitment details, supply leaves (issuance, burn,
and ignore), and chain proof that proves the commitment has been mined.

parameters.name: group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

post.summary:
tapcli: `universe sync`
SyncUniverse takes host information for a remote Universe server, then
attempts to synchronize either only the set of specified asset_ids, or all
assets if none are specified. The sync process will attempt to query for
the latest known root for each asset, performing tree based reconciliation
to arrive at a new shared root.

get.summary:
tapcli: `universe federation config info`
QueryFederationSyncConfig queries the universe federation sync configuration
settings.

post.summary:
SetFederationSyncConfig sets the configuration of the universe federation
sync.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

id.description: The ID of the asset to query for.
id.title: The ID of the asset to query for.

leaf_key.description: The asset key to query for.
leaf_key.title: The asset key to query for.

key.description: The ID of the asset to insert the proof for.
key.title: The ID of the asset to insert the proof for.

asset_leaf.description: The asset leaf to insert into the Universe tree.

group_key_bytes.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

chain_data.description:
The supply commitment chain data that contains both the commitment and
chain proof information.

spent_commitment_outpoint.description:
The outpoint of the previous commitment that this new commitment is
spending. This must be set unless this is the very first supply
commitment of a grouped asset.

issuance_leaves.description: The supply leaves that represent the supply changes for the asset group.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

id.description: The ID of the asset to query for.
id.title: The ID of the asset to query for.

leaf_key.description: The asset key to query for.
leaf_key.title: The asset key to query for.

key.description: The ID of the asset to push the proof for.
key.title: The ID of the asset to push the proof for.

server.description: The universe server to push the proof to.

group_key_bytes.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

anchor_tx.description:
The transaction that anchors the Taproot Asset commitment where the asset
 resides.

anchor_block_hash.description: The block hash the contains the anchor transaction above.

anchor_outpoint.description: The outpoint (txid:vout) that stores the Taproot Asset commitment.

internal_key.description: The raw internal key that was used to create the anchor Taproot output key.

merkle_root.description:
The Taproot merkle root hash of the anchor output the asset was committed
to. If there is no Tapscript sibling, this is equal to the Taproot Asset
root commitment hash.

tapscript_sibling.description:
The serialized preimage of a Tapscript sibling, if there was one. If this
is empty, then the merkle_root hash is equal to the Taproot root hash of the
anchor output.

block_height.description: The height of the block which contains the anchor transaction.

block_timestamp.description: The UTC Unix timestamp of the block containing the anchor transaction.

version.description: The version of the Taproot Asset.

asset_genesis.description: The base genesis information of an asset. This information never changes.

amount.description: The total amount of the asset stored in this Taproot Asset UTXO.

lock_time.description: An optional locktime, as with Bitcoin transactions.

relative_lock_time.description: An optional relative lock time, same as Bitcoin transactions.

script_version.description: The version of the script, only version 0 is defined at present.

script_key.description: The script key of the asset, which can be spent under Taproot semantics.

script_key_is_local.description:
Indicates whether the script key is known to the wallet of the lnd node
connected to the Taproot Asset daemon.

asset_group.description: The information related to the key group of an asset (if it exists).

chain_anchor.description: Describes where in the chain the asset is currently anchored.

prev_witnesses.description:
The asset's previous witnesses, which either contain the spending
witness stack (usually a signature) or the split commitment witness
(which is used to prove the split commitment of a split asset).

is_spent.description: Indicates whether the asset has been spent.

lease_owner.description:
If the asset has been leased, this is the owner (application ID) of the
lease.

lease_expiry.description:
If the asset has been leased, this is the expiry of the lease as a Unix
timestamp in seconds.

is_burn.description:
Indicates whether this transfer was an asset burn. If true, the number of
assets in this output are destroyed and can no longer be spent.

script_key_declared_known.description:
Deprecated, use script_key_type instead!
Indicates whether this script key has either been derived by the local
wallet or was explicitly declared to be known by using the
DeclareScriptKey RPC. Knowing the key conceptually means the key belongs
to the local wallet or is at least known by a software that operates on
the local wallet. The flag is never serialized in proofs, so this is
never explicitly set for keys foreign to the local wallet. Therefore, if
this method returns true for a script key, it means the asset with the
script key will be shown in the wallet balance.

script_key_has_script_path.description:
Deprecated, use script_key_type instead!
Indicates whether the script key is known to have a Tapscript spend path,
meaning that the Taproot merkle root tweak is not empty. This will only
ever be true if either script_key_is_local or script_key_internals_known
is true as well, since the presence of a Tapscript spend path cannot be
determined for script keys that aren't known to the wallet of the local
tapd node.

decimal_display.description:
This field defines a decimal display value that may be present. If this
field is null, it means the presence of a decimal display field is
unknown in the current context.

script_key_type.description:
The type of the script key. This type is either user-declared when custom
script keys are added, or automatically determined by the daemon for
standard operations (e.g. BIP-86 keys, burn keys, tombstone keys, channel
related keys).

raw_group_key.description: The raw group key which is a normal public key.

tweaked_group_key.description:
The tweaked group key, which is derived based on the genesis point and also
asset type.

asset_witness.description:
A witness that authorizes a specific asset to be part of the asset group
specified by the above key.

tapscript_root.description:
The root hash of a tapscript tree, which enables future issuance authorized
with a script witness.

data.description:
The raw data of the asset meta data. Based on the type below, this may be
structured data such as a text file or PDF. The size of the data is limited
to 1MiB.

type.description: The type of the asset meta data.

meta_hash.description:
The hash of the meta. This is the hash of the TLV serialization of the meta
itself.

taprpcAssetMetaType.description:
- META_TYPE_OPAQUE: Opaque is used for asset meta blobs that have no true structure and instead
should be interpreted as opaque blobs.
 - META_TYPE_JSON: JSON is used for asset meta blobs that are to be interpreted as valid JSON
strings.

anchor_out_point.description:
The outpoint of the asset anchor, represented as a string in the
format "<txid>:<vout>". The <txid> is the transaction ID of the UTXO,
hex-encoded and byte-reversed (i.e., the internal little-endian
32-byte value is reversed to big-endian hex format) to match standard
Bitcoin RPC and UI conventions.

asset_id.description: The asset ID of the asset anchored at the outpoint.

script_key.description:
The script key of the asset. This is the taproot output key that the
asset is locked to.

taprpcAssetOutPoint.description:
A transaction outpoint annotated with TAP-level asset metadata. It uniquely
identifies an asset anchored at a specific outpoint.

taprpcAssetType.description:
- NORMAL: Indicates that an asset is capable of being split/merged, with each of the
units being fungible, even across a key asset ID boundary (assuming the
key group is the same).
 - COLLECTIBLE: Indicates that an asset is a collectible, meaning that each of the other
items under the same key group are not fully fungible with each other.
Collectibles also cannot be split or merged.

taprpcAssetVersion.description:
- ASSET_VERSION_V0: ASSET_VERSION_V0 is the default asset version. This version will include
the witness vector in the leaf for a tap commitment.
 - ASSET_VERSION_V1: ASSET_VERSION_V1 is the asset version that leaves out the witness vector
from the MS-SMT leaf encoding.

decimal_display.description:
Decimal display dictates the number of decimal places to shift the amount to
the left converting from Taproot Asset integer representation to a
UX-recognizable fractional quantity.

For example, if the decimal_display value is 2 and there's 100 of those
assets, then a wallet would display the amount as "1.00". This field is
intended as information for wallets that display balances and has no impact
on the behavior of the daemon or any other part of the protocol. This value
is encoded in the MetaData field as a JSON field, therefore it is only
compatible with assets that have a JSON MetaData field.

genesis_point.description: The first outpoint of the transaction that created the asset (txid:vout).

meta_hash.description: The hash of the meta data for this genesis asset.

asset_id.description: The asset ID that uniquely identifies the asset.

output_index.description:
The index of the output that carries the unique Taproot Asset commitment in
the genesis transaction.

genesis_base_reveal.description: The base genesis information in the genesis reveal.

raw_group_key.description: The raw group key which is a normal public key.

tapscript_root.description: The tapscript root included in the tweaked group key, which may be empty.

txid.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

output_index.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

anchor_point.description:
The previous input's anchor point, which is the on-chain outpoint the
asset was anchored to.

asset_id.description: The asset ID of the asset that was spent as an input.

script_key.description: The script key of the asset that was spent as an input.

amount.description: The amount of the asset that was spent as an input.

prev_id.description: The previous input asset that this witness is for.

tx_witness.description:
The witness stack that is used to prove the asset owner's authorization
to spend an asset. This is only set if the asset is the root asset of an
asset split.

split_commitment.description:
The split commitment that is used to prove the split commitment of a
split asset. This is only set if the asset is a split asset.

taprpcScriptKeyType.description:
- SCRIPT_KEY_UNKNOWN: The type of script key is not known. This should only be stored for assets
where we don't know the internal key of the script key (e.g. for imported
proofs).
 - SCRIPT_KEY_BIP86: The script key is a normal BIP-86 key. This means that the internal key is
turned into a Taproot output key by applying a BIP-86 tweak to it.
 - SCRIPT_KEY_SCRIPT_PATH_EXTERNAL: The script key is a key that contains a script path that is defined by the
user and is therefore external to the tapd wallet. Spending this key
requires providing a specific witness and must be signed through the vPSBT
signing flow.
 - SCRIPT_KEY_BURN: The script key is a specific un-spendable key that indicates a burnt asset.
Assets with this key type can never be spent again, as a burn key is a
tweaked NUMS key that nobody knows the private key for.
 - SCRIPT_KEY_TOMBSTONE: The script key is a specific un-spendable key that indicates a tombstone
output. This is only the case for zero-value assets that result from a
non-interactive (TAP address) send where no change was left over.
 - SCRIPT_KEY_CHANNEL: The script key is used for an asset that resides within a Taproot Asset
Channel. That means the script key is either a funding key (OP_TRUE), a
commitment output key (to_local, to_remote, htlc), or a HTLC second-level
transaction output key. Keys related to channels are not shown in asset
balances (unless specifically requested) and are never used for coin
selection.
 - SCRIPT_KEY_UNIQUE_PEDERSEN: The script key is derived using the asset ID and a single leaf that contains
an un-spendable Pedersen commitment key
`(OP_CHECKSIG <NUMS_key + asset_id * G>)`. This can be used to create
unique script keys for each virtual packet in the fragment, to avoid proof
collisions in the universe, where the script keys should be spendable by
a hardware wallet that only supports miniscript policies for signing P2TR
outputs.

taprpcSortDirection.description:
- SORT_DIRECTION_DESC: Sort results in descending order.
 - SORT_DIRECTION_ASC: Sort results in ascending order.

root_asset.description:
The root asset that contains the transaction witness that authorizes the
spend of the asset.

servers.description: The federation server to add to the local Universe federation.

id.description: id is the ID of the universe to configure.

allow_sync_insert.description:
allow_sync_insert is a boolean that indicates whether leaves from
universes of the given proof type have may be inserted via federation
sync.

allow_sync_export.description:
allow_sync_export is a boolean that indicates whether leaves from
universes of the given proof type have may be exported via federation
sync.

universerpcAssetFederationSyncConfig.description:
AssetFederationSyncConfig is an asset universe specific configuration for
federation syncing.

asset.description: The asset included in the leaf.

proof.description:
The asset issuance or transfer proof, which proves that the asset
specified above was issued or transferred properly. This is always just
an individual mint/transfer proof and never a proof file.

asset_keys.description: The set of asset leaf keys for the given asset ID or group key.

leaves.description: The set of asset leaves for the given asset ID or group key.

req.description: The original request for the issuance proof.

universe_root.description: The Universe root that includes this asset leaf.

universe_inclusion_proof.description:
An inclusion proof for the asset leaf included below. The value is that
issuance proof itself, with a sum value of the amount of the asset.

asset_leaf.description: The asset leaf itself, which includes the asset and the issuance proof.

multiverse_root.description:
MultiverseRoot is the root of the multiverse tree that includes this
asset leaf.

multiverse_inclusion_proof.description:
MultiverseInclusionProof is the inclusion proof for the asset leaf in the
multiverse.

issuance_data.description:
The issuance related data for an issuance asset leaf. This is empty for
any other type of asset leaf.

universe_roots.description:
A map of the set of known universe roots for each asset. The key in the
map is the 32-byte asset_id or group key hash.

genesis_point.description:
The asset's genesis point, which is the outpoint of the genesis
transaction that created the asset. This is a hex encoded string.

total_supply.description:
The total supply of the asset. This is the total number of units of the
asset that have been issued.

asset_name.description: The human-readable name of the asset.

asset_type.description:
The type of the asset. This can be either a normal asset or a collectible
asset.

genesis_height.description: The height of the block at which the asset was created.

genesis_timestamp.description:
The timestamp of the block at which the asset was created, in Unix epoch
time (seconds).

anchor_point.description:
The anchor point of the asset, which is a human-readable string that
represents the asset's anchor point in the blockchain.

decimal_display.description:
The decimal display value for the asset. This is the number of decimal
places that the asset can be divided into.

group_key.description:
The group key of the asset group. If this is empty, then the asset is
not part of a group.

group_supply.description:
The total supply of the asset group. If the asset is not part of an asset
group then this is always zero.

group_anchor.description:
The group anchor that was used to group assets together into an asset
group. This is only set if the asset is part of an asset group.

asset.description:
If the asset is not part of an asset group, then this is the asset the
stats below refer to.

total_syncs.description:
The total number of syncs either for the asset group or the single asset
if it is not part of a group.

total_proofs.description:
The total number of proofs either for the asset group or the single asset
if it is not part of a group.

chain_data.description:
The supply commitment chain data that contains both the commitment and
chain proof information.

tx_chain_fees_sats.description:
The total number of satoshis in on-chain fees paid by the supply
commitment transaction.

issuance_subtree_root.description: The root of the issuance tree for the specified asset.

burn_subtree_root.description: The root of the burn tree for the specified asset.

ignore_subtree_root.description: The root of the ignore tree for the specified asset.

issuance_leaves.description:
The issuance leaves that were added by this supply commitment. Does not
include leaves that were already present in the issuance subtree before
the block height at which this supply commitment was anchored.

burn_leaves.description:
The burn leaves that were added by this supply commitment. Does not
include leaves that were already present in the burn subtree before
the block height at which this supply commitment was anchored.

ignore_leaves.description:
The ignore leaves that were added by this supply commitment. Does not
include leaves that were already present in the ignore subtree before
the block height at which this supply commitment was anchored.

total_outstanding_supply.description:
The total outstanding supply of the asset after applying all the supply
changes (issuance, burn, ignore) included in this supply commitment.

spent_commitment_outpoint.description:
The outpoint of the previous commitment that this new commitment is
spending. This must be set unless this is the very first supply
commitment of a grouped asset.

issuance_leaf_inclusion_proofs.description:
Inclusion proofs for each issuance leaf key provided in the request.
Each entry corresponds to the key at the same index in
`issuance_leaf_keys`.

burn_leaf_inclusion_proofs.description:
Inclusion proofs for each burn leaf key provided in the request.
Each entry corresponds to the key at the same index in `burn_leaf_keys`.

ignore_leaf_inclusion_proofs.description:
Inclusion proofs for each ignored leaf key provided in the request.
Each entry corresponds to the key at the same index in
`ignore_leaf_keys`.

proof_type.description: proof_type is the universe proof type which this config applies to.

allow_sync_insert.description:
allow_sync_insert is a boolean that indicates whether leaves from
universes of the given proof type have may be inserted via federation
sync.

allow_sync_export.description:
allow_sync_export is a boolean that indicates whether leaves from
universes of the given proof type have may be exported via federation
sync.

universerpcGlobalFederationSyncConfig.description:
GlobalFederationSyncConfig is a global proof type specific configuration
for universe federation syncing.

date.description: The date the events occurred on, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

sync_events.description: The number of sync events that occurred on this date.

new_proof_events.description: The number of new proof events that occurred on this date.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

group_key_str.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

asset_out_point.description: The outpoint of the asset to ignore.

amount.description: The amount of asset units at the associated asset outpoint.

leaf_key.description:
The key identifying the signed ignore outpoint leaf in the ignore supply
commitment subtree.

leaf.description: The signed ignore outpoint leaf in the ignore supply commitment tree.

runtime_id.description:
A pseudo-random runtime ID for the current instance of the Universe
server, changes with each restart. Mainly used to identify identical
servers when they are exposed under different hostnames/ports.

meta_reveal.description: The reveal meta data associated with the proof, if available.

genesis_reveal.description:
GenesisReveal is an optional field that is the Genesis information for
the asset. This is required for minting proofs.

group_key_reveal.description:
GroupKeyReveal is an optional field that includes the information needed
to derive the tweaked group key.

servers.description:
The list of federation servers that make up the local Universe
federation.

root_hash.description: The MS-SMT root hash for the branch node.

root_sum.description:
The root sum of the branch node. This is hashed to create the root_hash
along with the left and right siblings. This value represents the total
known supply of the asset.

proof_type.description: The proof type to calculate the multiverse root for.

specific_ids.description:
An optional list of universe IDs to include in the multiverse root. If
none are specified, then all known universes of the given proof type are
included. NOTE: The proof type within the IDs must either be unspecified
or match the proof type above.

multiverse_root.description: The root of the multiverse tree.

hash_str.description: The output as a hex encoded (and reversed!) string.

key.description: The ID of the asset a push was requested for.

events.description:
The list of grouped universe events that occurred within the specified
time range. Each entry in the list represents a day, with the number of
sync and new proof events that occurred on that day.

global_sync_configs.description: The global federation sync configs for the given proof types.

asset_sync_configs.description: The asset federation sync configs for the given universe IDs.

issuance_root.description: The issuance universe root for the given asset ID or group key.

transfer_root.description: The transfer universe root for the given asset ID or group key.

global_sync_configs.description: The global federation sync configs for the given proof types.

asset_sync_configs.description: The asset federation sync configs for the given universe IDs.

txn.description: The raw transaction that created the root commitment.

tx_out_idx.description: The index of the output in the transaction where the commitment resides.

internal_key.description: The internal key used to create the commitment output.

output_key.description: The taproot output key used to create the commitment output.

supply_root_hash.description:
The root hash of the supply tree that contains the set of
sub-commitments. The sum value of this tree is the outstanding supply
value.

supply_root_sum.description:
The sum value of the supply root tree, representing the outstanding
supply amount.

block_header.description:
The block header of the block that contains the supply commitment
transaction.

block_hash.description: The hash of the block that contains the commitment.

block_height.description:
The block height of the block that contains the supply commitment
transaction.

tx_block_merkle_proof.description:
The merkle proof that proves that the supply commitment transaction is
included in the block.

tx_index.description: The index of the supply commitment transaction in the block.

commit_outpoint.description: The outpoint in the transaction where the commitment resides.

universerpcSupplyCommitChainData.description:
SupplyCommitChainData represents the on-chain artifacts for a supply
commitment update.

type.description: The type of the supply commit subtree.

root_node.description: The root node of the supply commit subtree.

supply_tree_leaf_key.description:
The leaf key which locates the subtree leaf node in the supply commit
tree.

supply_tree_inclusion_proof.description: The inclusion proof for the supply commit subtree root node.

leaf_key.description: The key that identifies the supply leaf in the supply commitment subtree.

leaf_node.description:
The merkle sum node representing the supply leaf in the supply commitment
subtree.

block_height.description: The block height at which the supply leaf was created.

raw_leaf.description: The raw serialized bytes of the supply leaf.

outpoint.description: The outpoint associated with the supply leaf.

script_key.description:
The script key of the supply leaf. This is the script key of the asset
point.

asset_id.description:
The asset ID associated with the supply leaf. This is only set for
ignore type supply leaves.

universerpcSupplyLeafKey.description:
SupplyLeafKey identifies a supply leaf entry. It contains the components
used to derive the key, which is computed as a hash of these fields.

universe_host.title:
TODO(roasbeef): accept connection type? so can pass along self-signed
cert, also brontide based RPC handshake

sync_mode.description: The sync mode. This determines what type of proofs are synced.

sync_targets.description:
The set of assets to sync. If none are specified, then all assets are
synced.

synced_universes.description: The set of synced asset Universes.

id.description: The ID of the asset to sync.

old_asset_root.description: The old Universe root for the synced asset.

new_asset_root.description: The new Universe root for the synced asset.

new_asset_leaves.description: The set of new asset leaves that were synced.

asset_stats.description: The asset statistics snapshot for the queried assets.

host.description:
The host of the federation server, which is used to connect to the
server to push proofs and sync new proofs.

id.description:
The numeric ID of the federation server. This is used to identify
existing servers when adding or deleting them from the federation.
The ID of the asset to query for.

leaf_key.description: The asset key to query for.

id.description: The ID of the asset universe root.

mssmt_root.description:
The merkle sum sparse merkle tree root associated with the above
universe ID.

amounts_by_asset_id.description:
A map of hex encoded asset IDs to the number of units minted for that
asset. This only contains more than one entry for grouped assets and in
that case represents the whole list of assets currently known to exist
within the group. For single (non-grouped) assets, this is equal to the
asset ID above and the sum in the mssmt_root. A hex encoded string is
used as the map key because gRPC does not support using raw bytes for a
map key.

universerpcUniverseSyncMode.description:
- SYNC_ISSUANCE_ONLY: A sync node that indicates that only new asset creation (minting) proofs
should be synced.
 - SYNC_FULL: A syncing mode that indicates that all asset proofs should be synced.
This includes normal transfers as well.
